class.name: Barbarian
class.description:
__Rage consumes you in battle. You delight in wreaking havoc and using powerful weapons to carve through your enemies, relying on astonishing durability without needing complicated techniques or rigid training. Your rages draw upon a vicious instinct, which you might associate with an animal, a spirit, or some part of yourself. To many barbarians, brute force is a hammer and every problem looks like a nail, whereas others try to hold back the storm of emotions inside them and release their rage only when it matters most.__
----
***During Combat Encounters...***
You summon your rage and rush to the front lines to smash your way through. Offense is your best defense—you’ll need to drop foes before they can exploit your relatively low defenses.
***During Social Encounters...***
You use intimidation to get what you need, especially when gentler persuasion can’t get the job done.
***While Exploring...***
You look out for danger, ready to rush headfirst into battle in an instant. You climb the challenging rock wall and drop a rope for others to follow, and you wade into the risky currents to reach the hidden switch beneath the water’s surface. If something needs breaking, you’re up to the task!
***In Downtime...***
You might head to a tavern to carouse, build up the fearsome legend of your mighty deeds, or recruit followers to become a warlord in your own right.
***You Might...***
* : Have a deep-seated well of anger, hatred, or frustration.
* : Prefer a straightforward approach to one requiring patience and tedium.
* : Engage in a regimen of intense physical fitness—and punch anyone who says this conflicts with your distaste for patience and tedium.
***Others Probably...***
* : Rely on your courage and your strength, and trust that you can hold your own in a fight.
* : See you as uncivilized or a boorish lout unfit for high society.
* : Believe that you are loyal to your friends and allies and will never relent until the fight is done.
class.tWeapons: T:::Unarmed Attacks,,, T:::Simple Weapons,,, T:::Martial Weapons
class.tArmor: T:::Unarmored Defense,,, T:::Light Armor,,, T:::Medium Armor

class_features.name: Animal
class_features.description:
The fury of a wild predator fills you when you (feat: Rage), granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature. Select an animal from the table that best matches your chosen animal. **TABLE 3–3: ANIMAL INSTINCTS** Animal|Attack|Damage|Traits :--|:--|:--|:-- Ape|Fist|1d10 B|(trait: Grapple), (trait: unarmed) Bear|Jaws
Claw|1d10 P
1d6 S|(trait: Unarmed)
(trait:Agile), (trait: unarmed) Bull|Horn|1d10 P|(trait: Shove), (trait: unarmed) Cat|Jaws
Claw|1d10 P
1d6 S|(trait: Unarmed)
(trait:Agile), (trait: unarmed) Deer|Antler|1d10 P|(trait: Grapple), (trait: unarmed) Frog|Jaws
Tongue|1d10 B
1d4 B|(trait: Unarmed)
(trait:Agile), (trait: unarmed) Shark|Jaws|1d10 P|(trait: Grapple), (trait: unarmed) Snake|Fangs|1d10 P|(trait: Grapple), (trait: unarmed) Wolf|Jaws|1d10 P|(trait: Trip), (trait: unarmed) ***Anathema*** Flagrantly disrespecting an animal of your chosen kind is anathema to your instinct, as is using weapons while raging. ***Bestial Rage (Instinct Ability)*** When you (feat: Rage), you gain your chosen animal’s unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed on the Animal Instincts table above. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your (feat: Rage) action gains the (trait: morph), (trait: primal), and (trait: transmutation) traits.

class_features.name: Dragon
class_features.description:
You summon the fury of a mighty dragon and manifest incredible abilities. Perhaps your culture reveres draconic majesty, or you gained your connection by drinking or bathing in dragon’s blood or after watching a marauding wyrm burn your village. Select a type of dragon from the table to be your instinct’s dragon type. Chromatic dragons tend to be evil, and metallic dragons tend to be good.

**TABLE 3–4: DRAGON INSTINCTS**
Dragon|Type|Breath Weapon
:--|:-:|:-:
Black|Chromatic|Line of acid
Blue|Chromatic|Line of electricity
Green|Chromatic|Cone of poison
Red|Chromatic|Cone of fire
White|Chromatic|Cone of cold
Brass|Metallic|Line of acid
Bronze|Metallic|Line of electricity
Copper|Metallic|Line of acid
Gold|Metallic|Cone of fire
Silver|Metallic|Cone of cold

***Anathema***
Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema to your instinct. Choose whether your character respects or abhors your dragon type. If you respect it, defying such a dragon is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeat such a dragon you come across is anathema.
***Bestial Rage (Instinct Ability)***
While raging, you can increase the additional damage from (feat: Rage) from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to match that of your dragon’s breath weapon instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your (feat: Rage) action gains the (trait: arcane) and (trait: evocation) traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type.

class_features.name: Fury
class_features.description:
Your rage comes from a deep and purely personal well within you. You use your rage as you choose.
***Anathema and Instinct Ability***
You don’t have an anathema or an instinct ability. Instead, you gain an additional 1st-level barbarian feat.

class_features.name: Giant
class_features.description:
Your rage gives you the raw power and size of a giant. This doesn’t necessarily mean you revere giants – you might scoff at them or even aspire to slay them! You could instead seem like a giant to other people due to your exceptional strength or larger-than-life emotions and ego.
***Anathema***
Failing to face a personal challenge of strength is anathema.
***Titan Mauler (Instinct Ability)***
You can use a weapon built for a Large creature if you are Small or Medium (both normally and when raging). If you’re not Small or Medium, you can use a weapon built for a creature one size larger than you. You gain access to this larger weapon, of any weapon type otherwise available at character creation. It has the normal Price and Bulk for a weapon of its size (page 295). When wielding such a weapon in combat, increase your additional damage from (feat: Rage) from 2 to 6, but you have the clumsy 1 condition because of the weapon’s unwieldy size. You can’t remove this clumsy condition or ignore its penalties by any means while wielding the weapon.

class_features.name: Spirit
class_features.description:
Whether you are emotionally sensitive to the spirits around you; worship ancestors or apparitions; or are haunted by the specter of an ancestor, relative, friend, or foe, your rage takes the form of a spiritual possession.
***Anathema***
Disrespecting corpses or spirits is anathema to your instinct; defending yourself against undead creatures is not.
***Spirit Rage (Instinct Ability)***
When you are raging, you can increase your damage from (feat: Rage) from 2 to 3 and deal negative or positive damage, instead of the normal damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack (choose each time you (feat: Rage)). If you choose to deal negative or positive damage, your weapon or unarmed attack gains the effects of the (item: ghost touch | Ghost Touch Runestone) property rune, which makes it more effective against incorporeal creatures, and your (feat: Rage) action gains the (trait: divine) and (trait: necromancy) traits, plus (trait: negative) or (trait: positive), as appropriate.

class_features.name: Superstition
class_features.description:
A deep distrust of magic drives you to forgo and counter the metaphysical nonsense of spellcasters. Whether you're a member of a superstitious family or culture that distrusts magic, a warrior in constant battle against wizards and witches, a survivor of a magical accident that instilled an intense aversion in your mind and body, or a scion of a bloodline known for its magic resistance, your rage is inimical to magic. This makes you an excellent mage hunter but slow to trust practitioners of magical arts. Your extremely restrictive anathema grants you powers beyond those of other instincts.
***Anathema***
Willingly accepting the effects of magic spells (including from scrolls, wands, and the like), even from your allies, is anathema to your instinct. You can still drink potions and invest and activate most magic items you find, though items that cast spells are subject to the same restrictions as all other spells. If an ally insists on using magic on you despite your unwillingness, and you have no reason to believe they will stop, continuing to travel with that ally of your own free will counts as willingly accepting their spells (as do similar circumstances) and thus is also anathema to your instinct.
***Superstitious Resilience (Instinct Ability)***
While raging, you gain a +2 status bonus to all saves against magic. Increase your damage from (feat: Rage) from 2 to 4 against creatures that can cast spells. Once every 10 minutes, when you (feat: Rage), you regain Hit Points equal to the temporary Hit Points you gain from that (feat: Rage) action.

class_features.name: Ability Boosts
class_features.description: You boost four different ability scores. Each boost increases an ability score by 2, or by 1 if it's already 18 or above.

class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Instinct
class_features.description: Your rage wells up from a dominant instinct – one you learned from a tradition or that comes naturally to you. Your instinct gives you an ability, requires you to avoid certain behaviors, grants you increased damage and resistances at higher levels, and allows you to select feats tied to your instinct.

class_features.name: Rage
class_features.description: You gain the (feat: Rage) action, which lets you fly into a frenzy.

class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Skill Feat
class_features.description: You gain a skill feat.

class_features.name: Deny Advantage
class_features.description: Your foes struggle to pass your defenses. You aren’t flat-footed to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of your level or lower, or creatures of your level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.

class_features.name: General Feat
class_features.description: You gain a general feat.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you’re untrained in, or to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you’re already trained to expert.

class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Skill Feat
class_features.description: You gain a skill feat.

class_features.name: Ability Boosts
class_features.description: You boost four different ability scores. Each boost increases an ability score by 2, or by 1 if it's already 18 or above.

class_features.name: Brutality
class_features.description: Your fury makes your weapons lethal. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. While raging, you gain access to the critical specialization effects for melee weapons and unarmed attacks.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you’re untrained in, or to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you’re already trained to expert.

class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Skill Feat
class_features.description: You gain a skill feat.

class_features.name: General Feat
class_features.description: You gain a general feat.

class_features.name: Juggernaut
class_features.description: Your body is accustomed to physical hardship and resistant to ailments. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.
class_features.code:
GIVE-PROF-IN=FORTITUDE:M
CONDITIONAL-SAVE_FORT=When you roll a success, you get a critical success instead.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you’re untrained in, to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you’re already trained to expert, or to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you’re already an expert.

class_features.name: Weapon Specialization
class_features.description: Your rage helps you hit harder. You deal an additional 2 damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you have expert proficiency. This damage increases to 3 if you’re a master, and 4 if you’re legendary. You gain your instinct’s specialization ability.

class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Skill Feat
class_features.description: You gain a skill feat.

class_features.name: Lightning Reflexes
class_features.description: Your reflexes are lightning fast. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to expert.

class_features.name: Raging Resistance
class_features.description: Repeated exposure and toughened skin allow you to fend off harm. While raging, you gain resistance equal to 3 + your Constitution modifier to damage types based on your instinct.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you’re untrained in, to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you’re already trained to expert, or to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you’re already an expert.

class_features.name: Mighty Rage
class_features.description: Your rage intensifies and lets you burst into action. Your proficiency rank for your barbarian class DC increases to expert. You gain the (feat: Mighty Rage) free action.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you’re untrained in, to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you’re already trained to expert, or to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you’re already an expert.

class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Skill Feat
class_features.description: You gain a skill feat.

class_features.name: Greater Juggernaut
class_features.description: You have a stalwart physiology. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Fortitude save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Fortitude save against an effect that deals damage, you halve the damage you take.
class_features.code:
GIVE-PROF-IN=FORTITUDE:L
CONDITIONAL-SAVE_FORT=When you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.
CONDITIONAL-SAVE_FORT=When you roll a failure against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

class_features.name: Medium Armor Expertise
class_features.description: You’ve learned to defend yourself better against attacks. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to expert.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. You can use this increase either to increase your proficiency rank to trained in one skill you’re untrained in, to increase your proficiency rank in one skill in which you’re already trained to expert, or to increase your proficiency rank to master in a skill in which you’re already an expert.

class_features.name: Weapon Fury
class_features.description: Your rage makes you even more effective with the weapons you wield. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to master.

class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.description: You boost four different ability scores. Each boost increases an ability score by 2, or by 1 if it's already 18 or above.

class_features.name: General Feat
class_features.description: You gain a general feat.

class_features.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
class_features.description: The weapons you’ve mastered become truly fearsome in your hands. Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you’re an expert, 6 if you’re a master, and 8 if you’re legendary. You gain a greater benefit from your instinct’s specialization ability.

class_features.name: Indomitable Will
class_features.description: Your rage makes it difficult to control you. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

GIVE-PROF-IN=WILL:M
CONDITIONAL-SAVE_WILL=When you roll a success, you get a critical success instead.

class_features.name: Heightened Senses
class_features.description: Your instinct heightens each of your senses further. Your proficiency rank for Perception increases to master.

class_features.name: Quick Rage
class_features.description: You recover from your (feat: Rage) quickly, and are soon ready to begin anew. After you spend a full turn without raging, you can (feat: Rage) again without needing to wait 1 minute.

class_features.name: Skill Increase
class_features.description: You gain a skill increase. class_features.name: Barbarian Feat
class_features.description: You gain a barbarian class feat.

class_features.name: Skill Feat
class_features.description: You gain a skill feat.

class_features.name: Armor of Fury
class_features.description: Your training and rage deepen your connection to your armor. Your proficiency ranks for light armor, medium armor, and unarmored defense increase to master.

class_features.name: Devastator
class_features.description: Your (action: Strikes | Strike) are so devastating that you hardly care about resistance, and your barbarian abilities are unparalleled. Your proficiency rank for your barbarian class DC increases to master. Your melee (action: Strikes | Strike) ignore 10 points of a creature’s resistance to their physical damage.
